LongDescription: A centralized control center equipped with a suite of improved monitoring, management, and control systems for a ship's reactor plant, allowing crew to operate remotely from the localized controls, for more efficient operation of the power plant.
FlavorText:
All reactor bays have a lightweight version of these, but the actual PCC is far more specialized. Some of them are hooked up to an AN-2500 Superbrain and typically left to run in maximum efficiency settings to keep the warship powered during long deployments.

You can't go wrong with one of these, but the equipment is pretty delicate and despite constant complaints about monitors and control interfaces breaking down, the Naval Office doesn't really want to drop the funds to fix a problem that can be handled by most DC teams. Unfortunate, but not unexpected.

- I. Parker, CMC
